Events this weekend and beyond

5 fun things this week

Louisville 7:16 a.m. EST December 3, 2014

Important schedule.(Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Martinis & Mistletoe. Kentucky Museum of Art and Craft, 715 W. Main St., 5-8 p.m. Thursday. Holiday shopping at the Kentucky Museum of Art and Craft Shop and martinis provided by Finlandia Vodka. $20, free for museum members. (502)589-0102.

The 24th Annual WinterFair. Thomas Jefferson Unitarian Church, 4936 Brownsboro Road, 2-7 p.m. Friday; 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday. Indoor festival with more than 80 juried artists with jewelry, textiles, wearable art, pottery, art glass, paintings and more. A cafe will offer vegetarian food, soups, chili and desserts. Free.

Bardstown Road Aglow. Dusk-10 p.m. Saturday. Along Bardstown Road, Baxter and Barret Avenues and Douglass Loop. Boutiques, eateries and businesses will offer entertainment, food and drinks and entertainment. Trolleys will ride up and down the corridor offering free rides, Four Roses Bourbon will host their Annual Holiday Cocktail Contest in restaurants and bars, the lighting of the Highlands Holiday Tree at Wendy's and best decorating contest. Selfies with Santa (6-8 p.m.) at Bearno's, $5. Proceeds from Santa pictures benefit The Gilda's Club. www.bardstownroadaglow.com.

38th Annual Old Louisville Holiday Home Tour. Leave from the The Woman's Club of Louisville, 1320 S. 4th St., noon-6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Tour Victorian mansions and homes in Old Louisville. Shuttles run continuously to all stops on the tour. The Holiday Gift Boutique is open during the tour. $25 advance, $30 day of tour. Advance tickets: oldlouisvilleholidayhometour.org; day of tour at the Woman's Club. (502) 635-5244.

CONCERTS: Shows you don't want to miss

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

BRING THE KIDS: Top fun things for families

ON STAGE: 5 productions now playing

The Frankfort Avenue Business Association's 19th Annual Olde Tyme Christmas Celebration. Frankfort Avenue, 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Saturday. The celebration will includes the Santa Sprint and Stroll, dog walk, retail sales, live music, refreshments, and photos with Santa Claus at Margaret's Consignment from noon-3 p.m. Free trolley and horse and carriage rides along Frankfort Avenue (from Mellwood to Stiltz Avenue. noon-5 p.m.). www.frankfortave.com.

And lots more stuff to do ...

Events

First Friday Trolley Hop. Friday. Trolleys run from 5 to 11 p.m. The Fourth Street trolleys will be free and will make a loop from Market Street to Broadway to include additional businesses along Third and Fourth Streets. Most galleries and shops will stay open until 9 p.m.

University of Louisville host Ceramic Sale. Studio Arts Building, 2314 S. Floyd St., 8 a.m.-8 p.m. Friday; 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Saturday. Hand crafted ceramics by University of Louisville students and faculty artists that includes plates, mugs, bowls, large vases, serving bowls and platters, functional pieces and decorative works. Proceeds to benefit UofL Hite Art Institute's Ceramic Arts Organization and help fund student travel to art conferences and workshops.

40 Nights of Lights. 6-11 p.m. Friday and Saturday; 6-10 p.m. Sunday-Thursday. The nightly light show will be presented on the half hour synchronized to holiday music. Four blocks of Fourth Street (from Main Street to Muhammad Ali Boulevard) will come aglow with thousands of strands of multicolored LED lights that will animate 250 snowflake and fleur de lis fixtures. Runs nightly through Jan. 4.

4th Street Live Ice Rink. Part of Light Up Louisville and 40 Nights of Lights. Hours: 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Friday; 10 a.m.-11 p.m. Saturday; 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Sunday; 11 a.m.-7 p.m. Monday-Thursday. Through Dec. 26. Admission: $5 an hour, $3 for ages 12 and younger per hour, $10 day pass, $40 season pass, $2 skate rental.

The 24th Annual WinterFair. Thomas Jefferson Unitarian Church, 4936 Brownsboro Road, 2-7 p.m. Friday; 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday. Indoor festival with more than 80 juried artists with jewelry, textiles, wearable art, pottery, art glass, paintings and more. A cafe will offer vegetarian food, soups, chili and desserts. Free.

Christmastide 1816 at Locust Grove. 561 Blakenbaker Lane, 5:30-9 p.m. Friday; 4-9 p.m. Saturday. Features costume interpreters portraying members of the Croghan and Clark families, their friends and relatives; guided tours, hands on activities for children and period games. $6, $3 for children, $18 family (2 adults and up to 4 children under 18). (502) 897-9845.

Light Up CenterStage. Jewish Community Center, 3600 Dutchmans Lane, 7 p.m. Saturday. Features hors d'oeuvres, open bar sponsored by Heaven Hill, desserts and an original Broadway musical revue that will include a mix of past and present Broadway favorites. $90, $750 for a table of 10. (502) 238-2709.

Bardstown Road Aglow. Dusk-10 p.m. Saturday. Along Bardstown Road, Baxter and Barret Avenues and Douglass Loop. Boutiques, eateries and businesses will offer entertainment, food and drinks and entertainment. Trolleys will ride up and down the corridor offering free rides, Four Roses Bourbon will host their Annual Holiday Cocktail Contest in restaurants and bars, the lighting of the Highlands Holiday Tree at Wendy's and best decorating contest. Selfies with Santa (6-8 p.m.) at Bearno's, $5. Proceeds from Santa pictures benefit The Gilda's Club. www.bardstownroadaglow.com.

The 8th Annual Conrad-Caldwell House Holiday Victorian Tea. 1402 St. James Court., 11:30 a.m., 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. Saturday; 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. Sunday. The traditional Victorian Tea features a variety of sweet and savory treats and the house decked out in holiday decor. Proceeds to benefit Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. $30. www.conradcaldwell.org.

Whitehalls's Victorian Christmas Tea. 3110 Lexington Road, 2:45 p.m. Saturday. Tea will be served at 3 p.m. Features English tea, a variety of sweets and tea sandwiches served in a formal setting. Proceeds benefit Whitehall. $35. Reservations, (502) 897-2944.

The Nunnlea House 12th Annual Christmas Tea. 1940 S. Hurstbourne Parkway, 11:30 a.m. Saturday. Take part in a variety of tasty savories, scones, and sweets; and an assortment of teas as well as a featured tea. $25. Reservations, (502) 267-8780.

38th Annual Old Louisville Holiday Home Tour. Leave from the The Woman's Club of Louisville, 1320 S. 4th St., noon-6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Tour Victorian mansions and homes in Old Louisville. Shuttles run continuously to all stops on the tour. The Holiday Gift Boutique is open during the tour. $25 advance, $30 day of tour. Advance tickets: oldlouisvilleholidayhometour.org; day of tour at the Woman's Club. (502) 635-5244.

The Brennan House & The Conrad-Caldwell House Victorian Holiday Tours. Saturdays and Sundays, 1 and 3 p.m. through Jan. 4. Brennan House, 631 S. 5th St.; The Conrad-Caldwell House, 1402 St. James Ct. Both for $15. Tickets: preservationlouisville.org.

Bernheim Forest Holiday Open House. 2499 Clermont Road, Clermont, 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday. At the Visitor Center. Shopping, drawing for free gifts, music and refreshments. (502) 955-8512.

Riverside, the Farnsley-Moremen Landing Old-Fashioned Family Holiday Festival. 7401 Moorman Road, 2-8 p.m. Saturday. Photos with Santa, holiday crafts for children, carriage rides and a silent auction of holiday wreaths. Hot chocolate, coffee and cookies available for sale. Sponsored by the Dixie Area Business Association. Free admission. www.riverside-landing.org.

The Frankfort Avenue Business Association's 19th Annual Olde Tyme Christmas Celebration. Frankfort Avenue, 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Saturday. The celebration will includes the Santa Sprint and Stroll, dog walk, retail sales, live music, refreshments, and photos with Santa Claus at Margaret's Consignment from noon-3 p.m. Free trolley and horse and carriage rides along Frankfort Avenue (from Mellwood to Stiltz Avenue. noon-5 p.m.). www.frankfortave.com.

Spectator sports

University of Louisville Cardinal vs. Iowa Hawkeyes. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Thursday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Florida International Golden Panthers. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Friday. Men's basketball. $41. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinal vs. Kentucky Wildcats. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 2 p.m. Sunday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

Tastings

Wine & Whiskey Night. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-8 p.m. Thursday. Spirits from New Riff Distillery. Wine and whiskey will be $3 by-the-glass.

First Friday Beer Tasting. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-8 p.m. Friday. Beer tasting with Andrew Karl of Victory Brewing Company. $5; purchase any beer for $3 each.(502) 708-1313.

Moet & Chandon Champagne Tasting. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 7 p.m. Monday. $25, $20 for Tasting Club Members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

Cruise

Spirit of Jefferson Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, Friday and Saturday. Board, 6:30 p.m.; cruise,7-9 p.m. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Lunch/Sightseeing Cruise. Fourth and River Road, Saturday. Board, 11:30 a.m.; cruise, noon-2 p.m. $35, $34 seniors, $25 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Literary

Book signing. Costco, 5020 Norton Healthcare Blvd., 1-3 p.m. Friday. Steve Coomes will sign copies of "Country Ham."

Dances

Nuts N Honeys Dance Club. Dance Louisville, 8023 Catherine Lane, 7-11 p.m. Friday. Beginner and intermediate line dancing and couples dancing. $5. (502) 643-2786 or bigalofamerica@aol.com.

Singles Dance. Moose Lodge, 4615 Fegenbush Lane, 7:30-11 p.m. Sunday. Music by Kenny Sauter's Masters of Music DJ Service. Door prizes. $6 before 8 p.m.; $7 after 8. (502) 736-7600.

Exhibits

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre of Louisville Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "Kentucky Watercolor Society: Aqueous USA 2014," 37th annual juried exhibition. Ends Dec. 23.

The Arts Council of Southern Indiana. 825 E. Market St. "The Party in My Head," by Kent Epler. Ends Jan. 10.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15, 2015.

B. Deemer Gallery. 2650 Frankfort Ave. "Simply Louisville," by Steven Walker. Ends Dec. 17.

Bridge Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Seasons," by Carol Labashosky. Ends Dec. 15.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Filson Historical Society. 1310 S. Third St. "Steamboating on Western Waters." Ends Dec. 30. (502) 635-5083.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1. "Irving Berlin's White Christmas: The Exhibit." Ends Jan. 11. "Holidays Around the World," display of trees, lights and traditional holiday objects. Ends Jan. 4.

Galerie Hertz. 1253 S. Preston St. "Architectoplyast: Debrided Surfaces," by Jim Doiron. Ends Jan. 3.

Gallery Janjobe. Mellwood Arts Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Presents! Presents!," one-of-a-kind gifts by gallery artists and guest artists. Ends Dec. 24.

The Gallery at Mann and Fox. Professional Towers, 401 Dupont Circle, Suite 505. "The Art of Embroidery," by Bette Levy. Ends Dec. 31.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

House of Bleu Gallery. 2208 Dundee Road. Saturday, 5-10 p.m., "Iconic Images," the Courier-Journal photographers choose 60 of the best of CJ Photography Then and Now.

Huff Gallery. Spalding University, 853 Library Lane. "Ligne Rouge." Ends Dec. 19.

Jane Morgan Gallery. 4838 Brownsboro Center. "Paths in Nature." Ends March 14, 2015.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. "Abstract in Kentucky." Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Fine Art Gallery. 2400-C Lime Kiln Lane. Works by Jaime Corum, Lynn Dunbar, Robert Halliday and David Schuster.

Kentucky Museum of Art and Craft. 715 W. Main St. "Looming Local: Contemporary Kentucky Tapestry." Ends Jan. 25.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Ends Jan. 31.

Kore Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. Holiday Small Works Show. Ends Dec. 31.

Liberty Tattoo and Art Parlor. 2801 S. Third St. 6th Annual Under $50 Art Show. Ends Dec. 27.

Local Speed. 822 E. Market St. "Remix: Stephen Paul Day, Sibylle Peretti, The Leight Collection." "Color Me Justice," works created by students from Maryhurst Academy. Both end Feb. 21.

Louisville Free Public Library. Main Branch, 301 York St. "Lincoln: The Constitution and the Civil War." Ends Jan. 5.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Patio Gallery. Jewish Community Center, 3600 Dutchmans Lane. Mazin Art Exhibition. Ends Jan. 6.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. "Esthesia," by Carrie Burr, Paula Keppie and Wendi Smith. Ends Dec. 27.

Swanson Contemporary. 638 E. Market St. "En el Espirtu de Frida," honoring the 60th anniversary of the death of the great Mexican painter Frida Khalo. Works by Pilar Acevedo, Diane Khalo, Joe McGee, Mari Mujica and Jacque Parsley. Ends Jan. 3.

Tim Faulkner Gallery. 1512 Portland Ave. "Lines," a new collection of oil paintings by Jen Goodell. Ends Dec. 14.

University of Louisville's Cressman Center for Visual Arts. 100 E. Main St. "The Sardonic Eye: Bob Lockhart in Context." Ends Dec. 24.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. Opening Friday, "Karen Smith, The Artist." Reception, Friday, 5-8 p.m. Ends Dec. 29

Zephyr Gallery. 610 E. Market St. "Project 5: Stranger Than Function." Ends Dec. 20.

Other attractions

Lazer Blaze. 4121 Shelbyville Road, Friday, 4 p.m.-midnight; Saturday, 10 a.m.-midnight; Sunday, noon-9 p.m.; Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, 4-9 p.m. Laser tag, laser tag museum, arcade, cafe. $7 per game, $12 for two games. (502) 895-2985.

Robben's Roost. 5906 Six Mile Lane, Friday, 7-11 p.m.; Saturday, 1-4 and 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Sunday, 1-4 p.m.; Tuesday and Thursday, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Roller skating. Fridays, $6; Saturday afternoons, $4, evenings, $5; Sundays, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 491-8170.

Skate World. 6310 Preston Highway, 7-11 p.m. Fridays; 1-4 and 7-11 p.m. Saturdays; 1-4 p.m. Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Roller skating. Friday and Saturday evenings, $5; Saturday and Sunday afternoons, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 969-6000.

Wheel Fun Rentals. Waterfront Park. 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Bike rentals: cruisers, tandems, choppers, quad sports, deuce coupes, four-wheel surrey bikes. Group rates available. www.wheelfunrentals.com.

Open Range Sports. 6401 Cross Keys Blvd., Crestwood, 4-8 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. Indoor paintball/reball and a gun range. (502) 243-8282; www.openrangesports.com.
